summary_points: 1. On July 8, 2025, Franklin Resources, Inc.'s Board of Directors approved amended and restated bylaws adding a forum selection clause mandating the Delaware Court of Chancery as the sole and exclusive forum for certain legal actions.
2.  The filing does not contain any meaningful numerical comparisons.

3. The bylaws amendment establishing the Delaware Court of Chancery as the exclusive forum for certain lawsuits may reduce litigation costs and provide predictability in resolving disputes for Franklin Resources, Inc.
1. On July 9, 2025, Salesforce, Inc. appointed Amy Chang and David Kirk to its board of directors, effective immediately.
2. The appointments of Chang and Kirk aim to deepen the board's innovation leadership and technical expertise in the agentic AI era.
3.  Chang and Kirk will receive standard director compensation and equity awards, as detailed in Salesforce's April 24, 2025 proxy statement.
1. Jessica L. Warren's departure as General Counsel, Chief Compliance Officer, and Secretary was effective July 7, 2025.
2. The filing is an 8-K Current Report, submitted on July 9, 2025, concerning a departure of a director or certain officer.
3.  Ms. Warren is entitled to compensation and benefits as outlined in her stock option awards and Employment Agreement upon termination without cause.
1. Apple announced on July 8, 2025, that Jeff Williams will transition his role as Chief Operating Officer to Sabih Khan later this month, as part of a planned succession.
2.  Williams will continue in a reduced role until his retirement later in the year.
3. Apple's design team will report directly to CEO Tim Cook following Williams' retirement.
1. On July 8, 2025, Bunge Global SA completed exchange offers for outstanding notes, issuing $1,917,887,000 in new notes.
2.  $1,917,887,000 of new notes were issued, while $32,873,000 of existing notes remained outstanding and subject to amended terms.
3.  Bunge Limited Finance Corp. must file an exchange offer registration statement with the SEC within 180 days of July 8, 2025,  and complete the registered exchange offers within 365 days.
1. Procter & Gamble's Board of Directors declared a quarterly dividend of $1.0568 per share on July 8, 2025, payable on or after August 15, 2025.
2.  P&G has maintained a dividend for 135 consecutive years and increased it for 69 consecutive years as of July 09, 2025.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned in this section of the filing.
1. Kraft Heinz Co. amended its Credit Agreement on July 8, 2025, extending a $4.0 billion revolving credit facility's maturity date from July 8, 2029, to July 8, 2030.
2. The Amendment also revised the minimum shareholders’ equity financial covenant.

3.  The extension of the credit facility reduces the near-term risk of default associated with the previous maturity date (July 8, 2029) but introduces new risk associated with the later maturity date (July 8, 2030).
1. Sean D. Major resigned as Executive Vice President, General Counsel, and Secretary of Air Products & Chemicals, Inc., effective July 11, 2025.
2.  The terms of Mr. Major's severance and other benefits are disclosed in the company's definitive proxy statement filed December 3, 2024.
3.  Air Products & Chemicals, Inc. will name Mr. Major's successor at a later date.

1. On July 3, 2025, KLA Corporation replaced its existing revolving credit facility with a new unsecured five-year revolving credit facility with a principal amount of $1.5 billion, expandable by up to $500 million.

2. The new credit facility, expiring July 3, 2030, includes a sustainability-linked pricing component that adjusts interest rates and fees based on the company's greenhouse gas emissions and renewable energy usage.

3.  The Credit Agreement contains customary covenants restricting the company's ability to create liens and incur indebtedness, and includes events of default such as non-payment and breach of covenants, leading to potential acceleration of obligations.
